Organize data package

Source: vignettes/organize_data_package.Rmd
organize_data_package.Rmd

The data package

A data package forms a collection of data objects and metadata enabling understanding, use, and citation of a dataset. Metadata play an important role in understanding each object and how they relate to each other. EMLassemblyline works for all digital object formats and has been used by the Environmental Data Initiative (EDI) to create and manage well over 250 data packages for a nearly equal number of research scientists. Editing and revisioning data packages on short notice is made easy by EMLassemblyline but requires some forethought about file organization.

An organization scheme

A simple and useful organization scheme is a single directory for each data package containing:

  • data_objects A directory of data and other objects to be packaged (e.g. data tables, analysis scripts, .zip files, etc.).
  • metadata_templates A directory of EMLassemblyline metadata templates.
  • eml A directory of EML files created by EMLassemblyline.
  • run_EMLassemblyline.R An R file for scripting an EMLassemblyline workflow.
# Set working directory
setwd(tempdir())

# Template a data package directory
template_directories(
  path = '.',
  dir.name = 'pkg_301'
)
## Templating ./pkg_301
## Done.
# View directory contents
dir('./pkg_301')
## [1] "data_objects"                      "eml"                              
## [3] "metadata_templates"                "run_EMLassemblyline_for_pkg_301.R"

Any organization scheme is possible as long as all the metadata template files belonging to a data package are co-located in a single directory.
